scenario_text.value:
You took on the appearance of a child to...
protect Miyuki?

That’s right. For Miyuki’s sake, I changed my
form into that of Akiharu here.
Akiharu?
...That’s my name.
Wait, then...that means...

The Professor is Miyuki’s younger brother,
and he’s been to this world before?
Exactly.

But “younger brother” means smaller, right?
Huh? But aren’t you big?

Hrrm. The logic eludes me as well, but her
body stopped growing while in this world.
Huh! Isn’t that something?

So little Miyuki’s the big sister and big
Professor’s the little brother? My head hurts.

Um, so Miyuki wasn’t always like that?
I mean, kinda weird and quiet?
Indeed, my sister was once an emotional girl.

(Once, he says... So the girl I met back in
our world was the original Miyuki, then?)

When half of her soul was stolen by the
Master, Miyuki became a different person.

She forgot all about me, and all she did was
search high and low for her precious brother.

Even with most of her memories gone, she
never forgot about the Professor...

No, she forgot... After all, there’s no way
Akiharu could be in this world.

Miyuki put herself in danger in order to send
him back to your world, you see.
(Send him back...using that gate?)

Still, no matter how much I tried to stop
her, she continued to wander this world...
You can figure out the rest, can’t you?

Renamon... You kept protecting my sister in
my place this whole time.
You remember now?
Yes, not quite everything, but most of it...

So that’s why you were confused the first
time you met Renamon...as Haru.

Precisely. I may have forgotten memories of
my youth, but that form was like deja vu.

If only I’d believed sooner, maybe I could’ve
been useful to you kids...

Don’t worry about it. You’ve already been
an incredible help as it is!

No, I really am ashamed... Besides, not only
do I have to save Miyuki...

There’s something else I have to do.
I finally remembered it...
Something else?

I once left someone behind... Left them
alone, without a word of goodbye.
I have to save my irreplaceable partner.
Do you know who that partner is?

Indeed... However, the job might be too
difficult on my own.

What’re you talking about?! You better
believe we’re gonna help!
No, I’m grateful. It’s just...
I just have one question...
What is it?

Is there a chance this partner of yours
is likely to get in our way?
...Most likely, unfortunately.

...Then things are gonna get that much harder
from here on out.

(The professor is one of us. Of course I want
to help where I can.)

(But what if his old partner wants to fight?
I don’t want to hurt his partner...)

(And besides, saving Miyuki is top priority.
Maybe I should remind him of that?)
(What should I say to the professor?)
We’ll help you.
Isn’t Miyuki our priority?
We’re in for a fight.
We’ll help you.
Minoru’s right. We’ll help you, too.
Hey, no objections here.
Yeah, of course we will!

But you all have a mission. I cannot allow
you to get sidetracked by sentiment...

What’re you saying? You’re one of us,
Professor. No need to hold back.
Takuma... Everyone...
Miyuki’s the priority?

Isn’t saving Miyuki our priority, Professor?
I hope you haven’t forgotten that.
Yes, of course. I understand as much.

In that case, we oughta rescue your partner
as well.
...What?

Yes, as long as we know where our priorities
lie, there shouldn’t be any issues.
Oh... All of you...
We’re in for a fight.

This former partner of yours will want to
fight, right? Can’t you talk it out somehow?

Indeed... I intend to try, but his hatred for
me runs deep.

Perhaps a fight is unavoidable. If it comes
to that...I’ll have to rely on your strength.

I get it... In that case, we’d better prepare
ourselves.

Yeah. If we know a fight is coming, we must
plan accordingly.

Still, you want to patch things up with him,
don’t you? I’m sure he’ll understand that!

Welp, we’ll throw down if there’s no other
choice.
Everyone...
Thank you...so much. You have no idea.

...Get ready to go, everyone! The road ahead
is gonna get bumpy, so be prepared!
Got it!

Let’s meet up back here when we’re all ready!
For now, you’re all dismissed!
